content.xhtml:p:
TCP SOCKET EXAMPLE -------------------
This program demonstrates how to connect to a remote server using TCP to send and receive messages. To run the example, open a TCP server on port 12345 on a machine in your network and replace the '192.168.0.177' IP address on this example with your TCP server's IP.
You can easily start a TCP server using netcat (available on every Linux distro and macOS) with the following command:
nc -l 12345
PS: TCP Communications DO NOT work on Simulation. You will have to upload the program to the OpenPLC Runtime
Try to connect to the remote server. If connection is successful, SOCKET_ID will be greater than zero and CONNECTED must be set to TRUE
Create a 500ms pulse to signal when it is time to send a message
Send a message every pulse period if you are connected to server
Listen to messages from server (only if you are connected)
If received 'hi' from server, reply back with 'how are you'
